text.p: - World financial markets show great interest in shares of Russian gas company Gazprom which are to be sold for the first time outside Russia this week.

- The so-called special tax proposed by Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin to help finance the army, security and police could create a dangerous precedent for the budget if others who are in in need decide to press their interests.

- The idea that Russia rejects any territorial claims, as expressed in the Foundations of the border policy of the Russian Federation approved by President Boris Yeltsin on Wednesday, could trigger a negative international reaction.
- According to an opinion poll conducted by the All-Russia Centre of Studying Public Opinion (VTsIOM), Russian security chief Alexander Lebed is the politician most trusted by ordinary people.
- The new concept of the presidential administration created by the president's chief of staff, Anatoly Chubais, turns this theoretically auxiliary body into a powerful political structure.
- Alexander Lebed's visit to the NATO headquarters in Brussels was a mutual testing of the ground which failed to bring Russia and the alliance closer together.
- Boris Yeltsin has failed to fulfil his pre-election promises, says the paper's analyst looking back at the first 100 day of Yeltsin's new presidency.
- The effects of the conflict in Chechnya will be felt for a long time as the so-called Chechen syndrome develops among soldiers returning from the breakaway region.
